someone care to explain how a pyke with grasp and atma's doesn't compeltely bust the game?

Because it is literally impossible to build health on Pyke. The second half of his passive converts all bonus HP into AD, and since Atma's scales with max HP, it will only ever scale with his base HP. In other words, it won't necessarily be bad, but it will simply work far better on others.

It is actually possible to increase pyke's health with % hp increase that apply to base hp, as the health gained is still considered base health.

Not really practical but possible

ANYTHING can benefit from 125 AD, even if it isn't a primarily AD champion. that's generally 1/3 of any AD champion's build. Nasus, Sion and Poppy might primarily benefit from this as they're more AD focused but still, do we really want to see an extra 95(in that general area anyways) AD on Nasus either?

Anything can benefit from extra AD, but that doesn't mean they want it over other stats. Most tanks do not have AD ratios, so extra AD only boosts their autos. Sure, a Maokai with 250 total AD will have decent auto attacks, but that's not going to help him very much. He, and most other tanks, would prefer building straight defense or something that boosts their ability damage.

(All his minions have AD scaling, that makes whatever AD Yorick gains from Atma's also transfer to his minions. If Yorick has 4500 HP, Atma's will be a 137.5 AD item.

On his Mist Walkers, that's 675 Health, and Atma's adds 41.25 AD to each mist walker's damage. If you have 4 Walkers, that's an effective 165 damage per attack. If you have 8, 330 per attack (remember they can attack turrets and are NOT prioritized by turrets)

In addition, his Maiden of the Mists gains:

1350 HP 

and 68.75 damage per second.

What that all translates to: Yorick is going to rapidly kill people with minions now in addition to his shovel, and turrets are going to drop MUCH faster (which they already do, but the difference between 25 seconds of seeing him down a lane/attacking and 40 seconds is HUGE)
